name: The Hammock Samui Beach Resort

reviews.title: A small boutique place, nice details!
reviews.text: We enjoyed staying here in Mae Nam Village, at the Hammock. A trendy place, good value for money. The rooms are a bit small but comfortable and they have even a nice beach bag for the beach towels. Staff friendly and helpful. There is a computor with free internet to borrow in the reception/bar area. Cool red bean bags to chill in by the pool. I never saw anyone use it, but for children it might be good and it looks nice! Thursday evening is the Walking Street in the village. Go there! We walked along the beach 5 min to the right to Moonhut Bungalows for lunch as we had fiends staying there. Their food was always delicious. We had dinner once at The Hammock which was also good. The breakfast was a bit poor.

reviews.title: Perfect, loved out stay here
reviews.text: After spending 4 days in patong Phuket the hammock was a nice change, all the staff here are super friendly and this made our stay amazing.. I really don't want to leave, the beaches are beautiful and by far the best food I have had on our whole stay in Thailand.. Can't wait to come back :)

reviews.title: Hammock by name hammock by nature!
reviews.text: So relaxing! Away from the hype of Chaweng this is a real Haven in Samui. Modern minimalist decor, beautiful location, excellent breakfast, staff who just can't do enough to make your stay more comfortable yet are not in any way invasive. I intended to arrive here on Friday night but unfortunately missed my ferry as such arriving at 7am the following morning. My room was ready straight away on arrival. I pre booked and prepaid my accommodation and it was entirely my own fault however the staff kindly offered a late check out free of charge until 6pm Sunday when I depart for Phanang.

reviews.title: Cute little one
reviews.text: I was there with my boyfriends for 2 nights for a short vacation in Samui. We've never been to Samui before so had no clues where was the hotel and found the staffs were very helpful giving direction. Finally we got to the hotel by our car and found out there was no space to park my car. Anyway, the room we're in was lovely - it was a P-02. The shower curtain is a pain coz it would wrapped you up when you were showering. Rain shower was best! I love it. :) The swimming pool is too small and it is too close to the reception and the restaurant so we were too shy to swim there. The beach chairs were nice, the beachfront is lovely. The food and a quality of breakfast buffet is fair. Not fault for booking this hotel.

reviews.title: Finally! Quiet paradise!
reviews.text: After a week in noisy Bangkok & Chiang Rai, I was desperate for quiet sleep & was glad I chose Mae Nam over much noisier Chaweng.

reviews.title: Poor management.
reviews.text: Resort: stunning view on beach, good breakfast, nice staff (thank you Gandi for everything!), clean, smallish room (ie not big enough to do a workout), but hot water (took me 3 days to figure out how to get the right mix of warm on the taps), they provide beach bag & big towels, DVD movies, kettle/coffee in room, frig, AC (unfortunately couldn't change angle so sort of blasted the face at night & have to pay more to leave on while out), little deck. Grounds are adorable, leafy path to bungalows, well-kept, tidy, thick but plentiful pillows. The best: soooo quiet! They have strict noise rules so utterly silent by 9pm. Bliss! Reception "closes" at 11 but always someone around to give you your key. Book exchange, free wifi (only in one side of room so learned to plug in there to backup). Good restaurant, good mix of nationalities in guests, everyone polite, respectful, kids well-behaved even! Pool is very tiny so didn't use it but don't need to, as in other places, because beach is literally right there & super calm, clean water. I would absolutely love to stay there again.

reviews.title: Lovely Little Place, tucked away in Maenam Beach
reviews.text: Beach: golden sand, not white & fine like Chaweng, but Chaweng is if you want busy, nightlife, noise & tons of people. Water at Mae Nam is perfect, calm, warm, no noisy jetskis/speedboats/booze cruises. Gorgeous bay. Super shallow. Lots of beach chairs/umbrellas provided by hotel. Only weird thing is several stray dogs (at least 4) made it their territory, at times growling, lying under the chairs, & saw 1 defecate right on beach twice, so I guess there is no animal control (lots of dogs & cats on island). Not hotel's fault as they have a sign not to feed them, but I don't really want to swim around dogs.

reviews.title: Nice quiet hideaway
reviews.text: Location: A few steps from main road with restaurants, ATM & 7-11, & a block away from Thurs nite market which has great food & stalls set up, but far enough that no music heard, gorgeous sunsets, perfect! My suggestion for island is a bus service, because you have to sometimes wait for 20 min for taxi & costs about $16 to Chaweng, $8-16 for Big Buddha. Ko Samui is huge, would be more to Lamai, for example. Went to Full Moon Party on Samui, just as fun & less crazy than on Ko Phangan.
Located in Mae Nam beach in a quiet location.

reviews.title: Right on the beach
Great location and good food
reviews.text: Great location in the middle of Maenam beach...lots of beach restaurants nearby, but the food at Hammock Samui is really good, too! (We liked the glass noodle and the skewers). The rates were good and the room was pretty nice (the only downside was that there was very little ventilation in the room and it felt damp). Overall, we would recommend staying here!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Hotel is located on the middle of Maenam. Great view to Koh Phan Gan and the sea. Excellent beach that is always empty. Easy to find free lounge. Good breakfast. Good service. Close to main restaurants and working street.

reviews.title: Small beachfront hotel, good location and views

reviews.text: The Hammock is basically a 1.5-2 star hotel that has a great location. As we checked in, no one helped us with our baggage which we had to drag through the narrow drive, moving laundry out of our way, and then pick up and carry to our room. (I was expected to give the bellman a tip after that). I am glad we booked a beachfront room, otherwise the rooms are very small. Not good if you have lots of luggage. The beachfront room does have a very nice view of the water and two private mats that you can relax on, or chairs that are less than 5 feet away. Walking along the beach there is a great vender that sells fruit and grilled corn. The breakfast is nothing to rave about, but it was free and was a good snack before we began our day. The bar’s mixed drinks are so-so. The pool is very, very tiny. It gets crowded with 8 people in it.
reviews.title: fantastic location on quiet clean beach-gentle sea, smiling staff, small new resort.
